fields.description: It'd be nice in the email to have a link to Manage the subscription at the bottom of the email. Maybe a link to cancel the subscription would be nice too.
fields.summary: Add a link to manage subscription in the subscription email

fields.description:
We should make more explicit mention of the security implications around the index directories.

While some might argue that its "implicit" that access should be secured to the index directories we should state it explicitly in the docs

Two spots I suggest would be

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.9/searchindex.html


http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.9/security.html

In fact maybe we should have a section entitlled something like "Hardening JIRA"
fields.summary: Security implications on index directories should be more explicit

fields.description:
We often assign tasks to more than one person and would like the Assignee field to be multi-select.
Using a group or mail distribution list doesn't solve the problem  We want the ability to actually assign it to multiple people that we select.
fields.summary: Assignees:  Ability to select multiple assignees per issue

fields.description: We would like to be able to edit the date/time stamp when we edit comments.  Sometimes we don't have time to add a comment on the day the action took place.  If the comment is made a few days later, there could be other comments in the sequence of comments and then the comment we are entering causes confusion because the action appears to be out of sequence of what actually took place.  We'd like the ability to edit the date/time stamp of the comment so that we can maintain historical integrity of actions that took place on the issue.
fields.summary: Feature request:  Comments, ability to Edit date/time stamp

fields.description:
When a user in jira does´t know that his  session is expired ,  jira allows to add a a commentary in an issue but when user click on the button to add it  , jira  user is redirect to the login jira page and he loses the commentary.
We think that when the user click to add a commentary , when the session is expired , the application must  go to the login page instead allow write the commentary .
This  is resolved in any later jira version?
fields.summary: When session expires and a login is forced the add commet operation loses the original comment text
Ajax Group Picker

fields.description:
If we are importing Bugzilla bugs into JIRA, and some bugs have a summary over 255 characters:

{noformat}
mysql> select count(*) from bugs where length(short_desc) > 255;
+----------+
| count(*) |
+----------+
|        8 | 
+----------+
1 row in set (0.02 sec)
{noformat}

Then the importer will break with a long stacktrace, ending with:

{noformat}
(ERROR: value too long for type character varying(255) )) at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.singleInsert(GenericDAO.java:123) at 
org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.insert(GenericDAO.java:88) at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO.create(GenericHelperDAO.java:63) at 
org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.create(GenericDelegator.java:480) at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.create(GenericDelegator.java:460) at 
org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericValue.create(GenericValue.java:77) at com.atlassian.core.ofbiz.util.EntityUtils.createValue(EntityUtils.java:61) at 
com.atlassian.jira.issue.IssueImpl.store(IssueImpl.java:871) ... 79 more
{noformat}
fields.summary: Bugzilla importer breaks when summary contains over 255 characters

fields.description:
When viewing a portal page on the dashboard, the window title should also contain the page's name (much like if you're viewing a specific search request). 

This way when you have 3 different pages open on the tabs, you don't just get "Atlassian JIRA" for all of the tabs.
fields.summary: Window title of non default dashboard page should contain the page name

fields.description: A nice, auto-completing user picker.  Used in reporter, user custom fields and issue navigator
fields.summary: Ajax User Picker

fields.description:
The following integrity checks have an apostrophe before 's' after the  'FilterSubscription' word:

Check FilterSubscription's for references to non-existent QuartzTriggers.
Check FilterSubscription's for references to non-existent SearchRequests.

I think the 's' meant to make FilterSubscription plural, so we need to remove the apostrophe.
fields.summary: Subscription integrity checks are misnamed
untranslatable parts to issue comment edited emails templates

fields.description: The hungarian flag image is missing (404) in the right hand panel of language choices on *JIRA Setup step 1 of 3*
fields.summary: Hungarian Flag Image Missing on Setup Screen

fields.description:
Documentation for "Edit Issue Security Levels States:

'Edit Issue Security Levels
On this page you can create and edit the issue security levels for the "StandardTaskSecurityScheme" issue security scheme. '

Expected Behaviour: To be able to create and edit the issue security levels
Observed Behaviour: You can Add, and Delete, but not edit

Suggested Action: One of 
  o Changing documentation to note that you can create and delete issue security levels 
  o Changing the behaviour so you can Create and Edit the issue security levels.
fields.summary: "Edit Issue Security Level" behaviour does not match documentation.

fields.description:
To test whether or not I could import mantis issues in an existing project, I created an empty project with a name and a key.
When I imported a mantis issue list, specifying the exact same project name and key, another project was created with that name and key, instead of putting the issues in the existing project.

The ability to import mantis issues in an existing project is a lack of functionality, but the possibility to create a project with the exact same name and key is a serious bug.
fields.summary: Mantis importer creates new project with same name and key

fields.description:
When the Bugzilla importer creates new users for Reporter or Assignee fields, the password isn't valid. Ex-bugzilla users then come to log in to JIRA, and (not knowing that the importer doesn't preserve passwords) find their passwords rejected.

This is a bit unfriendly. The Bugzilla importer should optionally generate the standard 'new user' email for newly created accounts.
fields.summary: Bugzilla Importer should email newly created users with a password

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12825].
  {panel}

Hi,

A main concern from our customer is to have access to a report on the time taken from one status to another ie time taken to handle an issue ( time taken from Open--> Assigned, In Progress --> Resolved)

At the moment, you have to go into each single issue to have the information and it is impossible to collate all this.

Is there any plan to implement such reporting tool?

Rgds

Mel
fields.summary: reporting on change history : especially on status change

fields.description: If the AJAX Issue Operations are enabled and the comment field is configured to use wiki renderer, type in a long comment then click the preview button. The comment needs to be long enough to cause the preview HTML to be longer than the original comment text area. The screen is not resized and therefore only part of the preview HTML is visible and the form buttons (submit and cancel) are not shown.
fields.summary: Preview does not resize screen when AJAX issue operations are enabled

fields.description:
A customer made the following [support request|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-12734]. I will resolve that request and let the customer know to track it here instead.

Kind regards,
Ian

Jira currently cannot print information from separate custom-made tabs on an issue. The only way to print all the data is to click on each tab and print each one separately, which makes it a very tedious process.

The problem is greater if we need to print out all issues from the Issue Navigator by clicking on "Full Content". It only displays data from the first tab. This is causing the printing out of multiple issues for our weekly meetings very difficult.

The tabs are a great tool in separating out different kinds of data, and it would be great if the information can be printed out easily all in one go. Therefore, please kindly consider addressing the issue in a near-future release. Thanks for your help.
fields.summary: Cannot print data on separate tabs in one go
Unable to put multiple projects into customfields context with Jelly Tags
Project key cannot contain a slash (/)

fields.description:
Add a warning to the [Switching Databases|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/databases/switchingdbs.html] page of the JIRA Installation Guide saying that if you have another JIRA instance running on the same box (especially one that you exported the data from), make sure that you specify a different indexing path to that one.

I'll do it.

Cheers,
Ian
fields.summary: Add a warning to JIRA Install "Switching Databases" to make sure two instances aren't using the same search index path

fields.description:
It is very easy for customers to end up with two instances running on the same box, but have both using the same search index directory. Very bad! 

All they have to do is take a copy of their database and use it for the new instance.

In the absence of a proper solution such as something like JRA-11623, could we put some scary warnings in the Import Existing Data page, saying to make sure that the index path is not being used by another instance, for example, one that you may have exported data from?

I know this won't capture the case when the customer uses database management tools to copy the database. For that we'll need a proper solution. :-)

Cheers,
Ian
fields.summary: Warn in Import Existing Data to not use index path that another instance is using

fields.description: [1:14 PM] Bogdan Dziedzic: Hi Rosie, I've found a link on jira doc that loops...The page is http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/threaddump.html and the link is in the step no 5 http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/threaddump.html#threaddump_sample - I think it should be http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/threaddump_sample.html as it is in the part for Unix Env
fields.summary: broken link to Thread Dump Sample

fields.description:
I have posted the following question in the Jira forum and Confluence plugin page: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/JIRA+GANTT+Chart+Report+Plugin I am the service manager of the University of Tasmania for Jira and confluence products. I am testing the Gantt chart plugin in our Jira version 3.7.4. I created 2 issue tasks with due and estimated dates and when I try to create a Gantt chart then I get the following error: HTTP Status 404 - Could not execute action [ConfigureReport]:getAllIssues

Export to Word: more control

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12812].
  {panel}

I set the "User per Page" to 50 for the User Picker but when I use it the next time
it is reset to the default value 20.

The setting of "User per Page" of the User Browser of the Administration remember my setting though.

Please fix this for the User Picker.
fields.summary: User Picker does not "remember' the setting of "User per Page"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12811].
  {panel}

The 'Contact Administrators' screen is useful, but lists all administrators 'equally'.

In our organisation I am the primary administrator; and a couple of others also have admin rights for when I'm not available, or because they are trusted to do their own admin stuff for the projects they administer. Unfortunately they appear first in the list of administrators in the 'Contact Administrators' screen, and we have had a couple of incidents of users sending problem reports and requests to them; and these requests getting lost or delayed as a result.

It would be useful for us if we could either set a 'Primary' administrator contact; and have that displayed prominently in the 'Contact Administrators' screen; or even to be able to set the text for that screen so that a custom (html?) message can be displayed giving a preferred contact method/user. 
Being able to suppress the 'full' list of administrators would be useful, but is not a priority for us. However, companies with a publicly visible Jira server might want to hide this list to 'channel' all support requests via a single point of contact (eg. a mail list).
fields.summary: Add ability to customise 'Contact Administrators' screen

fields.description:
JIRA uses the system encoding when parsing CSV files. If the CSV contains any characters that are not valid in this encoding, they are silently accepted and replaced with question marks.

We should rather let the user specify the encoding explicitly in the CSV importer config file.
fields.summary: Allow setting of CSV text file encoding when importing

fields.description: The background color of a form causes text to be unreadable if client's system theme uses a dark background.
fields.summary: Background color of form causes text unreadable if system theme uses dark background color

fields.description:
Generally, people who are interested in 'import/export project' are interested in one of 3 things. We should create clear documentation presenting what the current options are for each of the 3 things.

The 3 documents are:

1. Archive or backup of a project for audit or emergency purposes in the future.

We need to write a new documentation that says this option is satisfied by backing up the entire JIRA instance before deleting the project.  Whilst you will have to restore the entire JIRA instance in the future, you can do this on another box, without interrupting your production instance.  

Given that it is for emergency purposes only, the extra time overhead of restoring the entire JIRA instance is not normally a concern.

2. Merging JIRA instances, or moving projects from one to another

We should write a new doc that explains that this is where we don't have any official tools.  However, there are a few tools that have been contributed by the community.  These are not officially supported, but are usually a good start.  

The doc should point users to Jeff's tools, and the codehaus tools.

3. Splitting JIRA instances

There is already a doc on this:
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/splitting.html

We should create links between all the 3 documents.
fields.summary: Create clear docs explaining options for import/export project

fields.description:
Hi,

I think we could use a short section on "Switching Servers" in the JIRA Installation Guide. 

I've written a draft. 

    http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/~idaniel/Switching+JIRA+app+servers

I'm waiting on review from Jeff. Once I have it and have made changes I'll re-assign this issue to Rosie to "forrest"-ize it.

Cheers,
Ian
fields.summary: Switching Servers section would be useful in JIRA Installation Guide
Filters should allow filtering by project role

fields.description:
A few problems (maybe even more then 1 issue)

We had the following resolutions: waiting for a meeting and on hold.
We changed the workflow so that they became statusses.
Problem is that you can't put the resolution on unresolved when deleting the resolutions.
Also the resolution can't be changed with reopen or edit.

I gues that I want the possibility to change the resolution as an editable field and that it shifts to unreolved if you reopen it.

For the moment they have resolution fixed (even if they are still open!)

All this is caused by the fact that when copying workflows the postfunctions and conditions aren't copied (I don't remember in what version I copied them so maybe it's already resolved)
fields.summary: Problems when changing resolution to status

fields.description:
Needs the abilty to create filters based on categories. 

We are generating pai chart using saved filters based on the status of the issues for all the projects. But we have many projects created relating to one category which we want all the project shown as one single unit in the graph. 

Hence, please provide project category selection field on the query filter or in the pai chart creation.

thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Allow filtering by project category

fields.description:
I tried deleting and re-adding the Project Table portlet, but I still get the following error:


Error rendering /portlets/dashboard/projecttables.jsp: /portlets/dashboard/projecttables.jsp:39: code too large for try statement } catch (java.lang.Throwable _jsp_e) { ^ /opt/j2ee/domains/atlassian.com/jira/resin/webapps/ROOT/WEB-INF/work/_jsp/_portlets/_dashboard/_projecttables__jsp.java:270: code too large for try statement try { ^ /opt/j2ee/domains/atlassian.com/jira/resin/webapps/ROOT/WEB-INF/work/_jsp/_portlets/_dashboard/_projecttables__jsp.java:23: code too large _jspService(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, ^ 3 errors.
Removing and recreating this portlet may solve the problem.
If not please ask your JIRA adminstrator to send a support request
fields.summary: Compiling the 'Project Table' portlet with resin using JDK 1.6 does not work

fields.description:
When a comment is edited, the HTML email lists 'Author' and 'Edited by' details, eg:

Author: Bob
Created on: 29/May/07 02:15 PM
Edited by: Test User
Edited on: 29/May/07 02:31 PM

The 'Edited by' is incorrect. It will be set to the original commenter, not the person who edited the comment.

Additionally, 'Author' is redundant and should be removed (once 'Edited by' shows the right person).
fields.summary: Edit Comment email notification mixes up updater with original commenter

fields.description:
When a comment is edited in JIRA, an email notification goes out. For the HTML mail, this email includes useful details like:

Author: Fred
Created on: 25/May/07 13:11
Edited by: Joe
Edited on: 25/May/07 14:15"

The equivalent text template (issuecommentedited.vm) doesn't contain these details.
fields.summary: Edit Comment text email notification does not list 'Edited on' and 'Edited by' details

fields.description:
Customer is getting the following errors in the log file:
{noformat}
[issue.customfields.impl.AbstractSingleFieldType] More than one value stored for custom field id'customfield_10081'.  Values [john.smith, john.smith, mary.brown]
{noformat}
Here is the [support case|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-12235#action_110584]. The customer has 160,000 issues, and can have up to 300 concurrent requests. Several users can be modifying the same issue at the same time.

The customer says that every few weeks he needs to go into the database and delete the multiple rows. I gave him [the SQL|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-12235#action_107959] to do this. Once he removes the multiple rows from the database he can re-index the issue, and once this is done it can be viewed again in JIRA. However the issue recurs.

This issue has come up before - JRA-11382 - but in that case there was more than one thread of execution in an SOAP client modifying the same issue. The customer assures me that in his case does not have any software programs modifying issues.

Cheers,
Ian
fields.summary: Multiple values being stored for single value custom fields
Display issue description and comments when performing a workflow action

fields.description:
When our JIRA system was originally stood up, there were some mistakes made such that some of the issue types and workflows always closed with a resolution of "Unresolved."  We have since gone in and corrected the workflows, however there are still hundreds of issues that have an incorrect resolution and we need to set these resolutions appropriately so that our reporting metrics accurately reflects the project's issues and status.

There are two work arounds that I know of, but neither of them seems to be efficient for the problem I am having.
-I can bulk transition the issues to a different step of the workflow, and then move them back again.
-I can add the resolution field to the edit screen, and manually go into each issue and correct the resolution.

What I would like is that resolution be made available for the 'bulk edit' option.
fields.summary: Allow for Bulk Resolution Change on Issues with 'Closed' Status

fields.description:
When creating a new version on the ManageVersions page, you can specify the new version's position in the version list.

However, the EditVersionDetails page does not let you reset this property - I'd like to see the same drop-down list be available (minus the version being rescheduled of course) on EditVersionDetails.

I know that you can change the position of a version, but then you have to click on the arrows to move the version one line at a time.  This is extremely tedious when you have a large number of versions and somebody accidentally clicked on the "send to top" or "send to bottom" button associated with one of the versions in the middle of the list.  (It would help if the refreshed page automatically scrolled down to the previous scroll position, but that is not the issue here, and it would still be tedious to move one line at a time).
fields.summary: Allow versions to be rescheduled to an arbitrary position on the Edit Version Details page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12789].
  {panel}

Hi,

*+Issue:+*
Our users would like to have possibilty to choose when they want to send email.

Like when you add comment, they want to choose to sending email like "Send email to... [X]" or not to send ""Send email to... [ ]"

*+Improvement:+*
+MUST:+ Is it possible to add this kind of "Send email.." check box below "Viewable by:" field?
+WISH:+ They also would like to see who will get that email.

-JP
fields.summary: Possibility choose to send email or not when notification event is triggerred
add IE7 to the supported browsers

fields.description:
Users can create filter subscriptions, can click "run now" and the last sent and next send are shown - even if there is no mail server configured in the system.

Additionally, the mail queue gets an email in it which will never be sent until a mail sever is added.

The user should not be able to edit or run filter subscriptions (and they should not attempt to run or enqueue emails). The user should not be given the impression that email will be or has been sent.
fields.summary: filter subscriptions pretend to work happily even when there is no configured mail server

fields.description:
.exe JIRA installed in a clean xp and than in 2003;
service is installed by doesn't start up if you try to do it manually you get a pop-up with error as per  serviceStartupError.JPG

OS system logs:

The Atlassian JIRA Enterprise Edition 3.8.1 service terminated with service-specific error 0 (0x0)

and Tomcat logs:

[2007-05-24 14:20:19] [info] Starting service...
[2007-05-24 14:20:19] [924  prunsrv.c] [error] Failed creating java 
[2007-05-24 14:20:19] [1179 prunsrv.c] [error] ServiceStart returned 1

if you try to start up JIRA from command you get:

C:\JIRA-Enterprise-3.9\bin>startup.bat
JAVA_HOME "" contains spaces. Please change to a location without spaces if this causes problems.
If you encounter issues starting up JIRA Standalone Edition, please see the Troubleshooting guide at http://confluence.atlassian.com/troubleshooting+Guide
Neither the JAVA_HOME nor the JRE_HOME environment variable is defined
At least one of these environment variable is needed to run this program

although you can still start JIRA as an application with startup_bundled_jre.bat

additionally you can't unregister the service as per [doc|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/runasservice.html] with: 
service.bat remove JIRA

correct command is :
service.bat remove JIRA240507133018
fields.summary: windows installer failing to set windows service correctly

fields.description: Need an easy way of seeing the total nuumber of bugs when I click on a project. Clicking Open Issues should also show me how many open issues there are. I can see individual counts across the various workflow stages, but I can't get round totals!

fields.description: Ideally, we can schedule the backup service to run at certain period of time instead of by interval. It's something similar to the new subscription email model.

fields.description:
* admin.generalconfiguration.email.from.header.description "From:"
should not be translated because it's a literal mail header.
* admin.generalconfiguration.masked Email visibility setting: Masked
"user at example dot com" should not be translated, as it comes out
literally from the masking code.
* admin.generalconfiguration.enable.email.header "Precedence: bulk"
should not be translated because it is a literal mail header.

Also the following formats should not be translated, but the example
should be localised.

admin.globalsettings.lookandfeel.eg.time.format=E.g. hh:mm a (11:55 AM)
admin.globalsettings.lookandfeel.eg.day.format=E.g. EEEE hh:mm a
(Wednesday 11:55 AM)
admin.globalsettings.lookandfeel.eg.complete.date.time.format=E.g.
dd/MMM/yy hh:mm a (01/Jul/03 11:55 AM)
admin.globalsettings.lookandfeel.eg.day.month.format=E.g. dd/MMM/yy
(01/Jul/03)
fields.summary: Bad i18n messages

fields.description:
AJAXy goodness to improve the responsiveness of the issue navigator would be great.

In particular refreshing the search menu when choosing a project would be very useful.
fields.summary: add AJAX goodness to the issue navigator

fields.description: When there are 8 sections in a pie chart, the original color (red) is displayed for the first and 8th sections. This is somewhat confusing to look at.
fields.summary: Pie Char shows same colors side by side if 8 sections

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12773].
  {panel}

Hello JIRA team,

I want to have a custom field required without a  "none" option on the resolve screen.  
These are the requirements of a custom field and all of them should be maintained at the same time :(
1) The custom field to be required
2) The custom field not to have a "none" option
3) The custom field to be on the resolve screen
4) The custom field to not effect submit screen or other screens which does not have this custom field

If I make the custom field "required",  then the submit screen does not allow me to make a transition without filling this required custom field although it belongs to the resolve screen.
So, I downloaded the extension "Workflow Validator to require a field on a transition screen" and make the custom field "optional".  The problem of transition is fixed but  a  "none" option appears for this field value on the resolve screen.

Please help me

Thanks and Best regards,

Lerzan Sencer
fields.summary: Provide a custom field required  without a  "none" option on the resolve screen
Add XML elements containing absolute URL for issue type icon, priority icon and status icon to XML issue navigator view

fields.description: JIRA version is incorrectly displayed. Only the build number is displayed, major and minor version number is missing. See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: JIRA version is incorrectly displayed in the footer of Full Content issue navigator view

fields.description:
It would be very advantageous to be able to click on a column heading when viewing, for example, a list of projects, to be able to sort on that heading
For example, it would be very helpful to be able to sort the list of projects on the main Admin screen by Project Lead, or by Key.
fields.summary: Ability to sort column fields at the Administration Screen

fields.description:
Problem:  customers want to be able to bulk create subtasks.

Issue:  no way to do this in current system.

Possible approaches (in order of preference):
1.  Jelly tag to create subtasks, either as a sub tag of the parent create or as a stand-alone tag.
2.  Jelly tag to associate a subitem to an existing item.
3.  Allow bulk change of task to subtask.  This would then allow a cludge of creating the items as a false issue type (foo), then changing all items of type foo to subitems of a particular parent item.  Though there might be hope here in 3.9, but was denied.
fields.summary: Bulk change of task to subtask AND/OR implement subtask creation or linking in Jelly Tags

fields.description: We would like to create a public user feedback mechanism where a non-development team user can enter issues from a link in a web application and the issue goes directly into JIRA.  We'd like to give that user a special issue type called "Feedback" and they can only see this issue type and not the others on the project (like bug or improvement).  How can I do this in JIRA?
fields.summary: Public "Create Issue" screen for a project

fields.description:
Whenever a default dashboard is inherited or restored by a user, JIRA does not check if a user has the permission to view its portlets. It happens to 'Assign to me' and 'In Progress' portlet. 

Steps to reproduce the problem:

1) Create a default dashboard with 'Assigned to me' portlet
2) Create  a user who does not have the assignable permission in any project
3) Use the user to login and you can see the 'Assigned to me' portlet is still visible
4) Click on the 'Configure Dashboard' link, the portlet will disappear. (Same goes to 'In Progress' portlet)

Perhaps there should be a checking before the portlet is being rendered.

Cheers,
Terry
fields.summary: Default dashboard should check visibility of portlet
Update create issue development documentation

fields.description:
Hi,

My organization is a small Managed Service Provider focusing on Linux, VMware, and Security with clients throughout Southern California.  We currently have Jira deployed to provide a support interface for our clients.  Each client gets their own queue for support requests and project issue tracking.  Unfortunately, when issues like a security vulnerability or new patch that impacts a particular technology that may be deployed across multiple customers occur, we have to create seperate tickets in each client queue and update each of these tickets with any general information we later receive.

What we would like instead is to be able to create a specific queue per general technology (vmware), but have the queue act in such a manner that any tickets created in it are automatically cloned as subtasks for each impacted client queue (client queues would subscribe to the master ticket queues).  The subtasks would generall be managed and updated seperately as each client would have their own schedule/issues associated with resolution --- but it would be nice if we could provide general information updates to all clients on a task by adding additional comments to the master ticket.

Please advise if you guys think this could ever be implemented in Jira.

Regards,
M. Marlowe
DeployLinux Consulting, Inc
fields.summary: Support for Master Tickets for MSP type organizations in Jira

fields.description: When assigning groups to a project role, the screen allows the user to specify a group that is really a user name.
fields.summary: Assign Groups to Project Role screen allows entry of users as groups

fields.description:
The excel export (Issue Navigator) is currently not able to escape certain arithmetic operators such as =, -, +, etc. If the cell data is starting with these operators, excel will treat it as a formula and it will not allow a formula that consists more than 1024 characters with the error message "Cell data too large".

h4. Workaround
Can be found in [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-12759?focusedCommentId=80176&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-80176]
fields.summary: Excel export should escape the certain arithmetic operators

fields.description:
# Go to [JSP-12235|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-12235].
# Edit the (long) comment made by me (Ian Daniel) at 18/May/07 12:41 AM.
# The whole text of the comment is not included in the edit text window. This is the last line of text included:

{code}
You say in your latest email that you have read the [Causes of OutOfMemoryErrors|http://confluence.atlassian.com/
{code}

This is not the end of the comment.

If you do a View Source, all the comment text is in the HTML, but Firefox is not showing it all.

It works fine in Internet Explorer 5.

Cheers,
Ian
fields.summary: Editing a comment does not show all the comment text in the text editor in Firefox

fields.description:
The following line of HTML code is malformed. The tag shouldn't have a '/' character at the end. This markup is usually for tags like
and . I found this specifically because the apache module mod_proxy_html interperates this tag as a single tag and breaks the HTML (where browsers would normally ignore this error). This line of code only appears when viewing an issue. The offending code: Watchers: 0  (View) The fix: Watchers: 0  (View)
fields.summary: HTML error with watchers link when viewing a bug

fields.description:
We do not want our support engineers to be able to change the Reporter but when creating a new issue for Customer on the phone
for instance they can not set the Reporter to the customer.
fields.summary: Split the Modify Reporter Permission in two: one for Creating and one for Editing.

fields.description: It should be possible for an administrator to change the username of any user and for a user to change it's own.
fields.summary: Changing the username

fields.description:
I'd like to add a custom field 'sub-components' . Obviously, I want it only to show the sub-components that are related to the main component field (which is a built-in field!). I can't do it today - all I can do is duplicate the component field (a builtin field), then use its context. This is a pity. Example:
Components: GUI, User Mode, Kernel
Subcomponents for GUI: User Interface, Help, Graphics
subcomponents for User Mode: daemon, comm. module
subcomponents for kernel: device driver, performance

Thanks,
Yaniv (ykaul@qumranet.com)
fields.summary: Make a custom field depend on the context of the component
Option to show resolved issues for popular issues
Customfields in plugin not shown

fields.description:
Say we have a post-function, which for some reason fails, throwing an exception. If the post-function occurs first, JIRA's workflow step will be advanced, but the workflow state will remain as-is (because the UpdateIssueStatusFunction hasn't run), leaving the issue in an inconsistent state:

!brokenworkflow.png!

(here, the "Stop Progress" link shouldn't be there since the status is "Open")
fields.summary: Failing post-functions leave issues in invalid state

fields.description:
I think we need some improvement on the IIS instructions in the CAC's and JIRA documentation. There seems to be a little bit of inconsistency such as, we are asking the users to check the "Execute (Such as ISAPI application of CGI)" for the virtual directory in the CAC's documentation, but in the JIRA's one, this is missing.

I have set up IIS v5.1 and its integration with JIRA by following the JIRA documentation. I found that setting the ISAPI filter is one of the requirements in order for the proxy/redirection to function properly, but the documentation says that it's for IIS v6. 

These are the documentation I'm referring to.

* http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/iisintegration.html
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+IIS+with+Tomcat

The Confluence's IIS integration guide is working and can be a reference anyway:

* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Setting+up+Confluence+with+IIS
fields.summary: Improvement on Integration with IIS document

fields.description:
I have a permission scheme that gives "jira-administrators" the administer project permission. If the jira-administrators gets added to the administrator role, I can't remove it because it says:

You can not remove a user/group that will result in completely removing yourself from this role.

I don't want the jira-admins as the administrator role because I also give this role the assignable user permission which isn't needed for jira-admins.

I have also seen this error when the project lead, who is not a "jira-administrator" member and is specifically listed in the Administrator role by userid, tries to remove the jira-administrator group from the role
fields.summary: Attempts to remove groups from Adminstrator role incorrectly fail with message "You can not remove a user/group that will result in completely removing yourself from this role"

fields.description: FileFactory will be removed from atlassian-core.  This class is needed only in JIRA.
fields.summary: Move FileFactory from atlassian-core into JIRA source

fields.description: We have a little-used [plugin point|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Programmatically+determining+automatic+assignee] for setting the default assignee, added in 3.6. It appears to be broken (not invoked at all) in 3.8.1.
fields.summary: Programmatically determining assignee plugin point broken

fields.description: We would like to be able to search for issues where any member of a group has participated. Currently only 1 user at a time can be searched.
fields.summary: participants search box should take groups in addition to users

fields.description: When a custom field has defined options using HTML and is attached to a mutli-select search template, it is not possible to correctly search on those fields. For example, we have a custom field called 'Status', with a value of "Green", which just adds a green background to the field in the Issue Navigator. With the single-select searcher, the Find Issues query panel will correctly list "Green" along with the other options. With the multi-select searcher, the Find Issues query panel will incorrectly list (given verbatim below): Green">Green ... which doesn't correctly match any issues. Escaping the "<" and ">" symbols doesn't appear to have the desired effect either.
fields.summary: Multiselect Search Template doesn't honor HTML

fields.description:
# click browse project
# note the current selection of _Browse Project_ - as it should be.
# if you see all projects, choose a project - if you see a single project do nothing
# click the Road Map Project Tab Panel (or Open Issues if Road Map is already selected)
# note the lack of selection of _Browse Project_ along the top page navigation. (n)
fields.summary: Browse Project visual selection status is lost when selecting project tab panels

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12736].
  {panel}

The User Browser administration interface is nice and simple, but when you have 370 users it is sometimes hard to find people.

Suggestion 1:

Allow sorting on the headlines, e.g. sort on Full Name or email

Suggestion 2:

Search on more fields than just email, such as full name and user name

Suggestion 3:

Instead of splitting the result into pages 1, 2, 3, 4 split by characters in the alphabet, e.g. A B C D E. You don't need to go fancy and do A-F, G-I etc, it would be enough just to choose the first letter.

PS The Jira user admin interface is a LOT better than the Confluence admin interface, it's very confusing with the required wildcard characters. Well done Jira!

PPS I guess the "Users Per Page: All" option was designed to avoid the above suggestions
fields.summary: Allow to sort the user list on User Browser on different user attributes
Make watch list sortable
Make Issue Links column sortable in Issue Navigator

fields.description: Nice auto-complete feature for issue picker.
fields.summary: Ajaxify Issue Picker

fields.description:
It looks like we aren't calculating the initial size correctly on the AJAXy operations.

See screen shot !safari-ajax.png|thumbnail!

This was before we upgraded to yui 2.2.2.  It is still broken.
fields.summary: Ajax operations do not resize correctly on Safari

fields.description: nevermind ..
fields.summary: Hitting <enter> in quick search retrieves all rows

fields.description:
Hi,

i am intensively working on a bunch of workflows, where i get the problem of discussing the design with my customers (and colleages).
It is quite complex to have all the relations in mind when you work on a workflow, add validations and events etc. for transitions and configure a mail scheme.

When you try to discuss this with somebody who is not completely involved talking gets difficult.

An overview in some way, maybe even graphical at parts, would help much to get an impression what the actual status is like.

I hope my explanatin is understandable enough to get my point :)

best regards,

Michael
fields.summary: Overview for entire designed workflow (including events and sent mails)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12726].
  {panel}

Increasingly, within our organisation, Jira is being used by non-IT departments. These departments would like to use the "Component" and "Versions" functionality, but would like the ability to customise the text to fit their specific domains.

I propose that the text labels for these be configured on a per project basis.

Cheers

Michael
fields.summary: Allow per-project customisation of the "Components" and "Versions" text.
Every JIRA user should see his assigned project roles in his profile view
New global permission "create projects"  (CLONE  of Project Administrator should be allowed for creating projects)
Colour of square brackets for issue activity

fields.description:
A customer has requested that the ability to configure your own dashboard in JIRA should be customizable (to be disabled for some reason). I think this is a valid request, since many organizations have strict policies on consistency of information displayed to the user. My recommendation is a Global Permission to control this.

[ipc.com]
fields.summary: Add "Configure Dashboard" as a Global Permission
Component is always swapped while being deleted

fields.description:
The "Large Attachment Storage" feature introduced in version Bugzilla 2.20 allows you to store large attachments on disk instead of the database:

* http://www.bugzilla.org/releases/2.20/release-notes.html

Currently, the Bugzilla importer doesn't takecare of this, it will create 0-byte attachments instead.
fields.summary: Bugzilla Importer to take care of "Large Attachment Storage" feature (local attachments)

fields.description:
After changing the jira.projectkey.pattern from ([A-Z][A-Z]+) to ([A-Z][A-Z][A-Z0-9]+) viewing an issue (../browse/<issue-id>) doesn't work any more an the following error message is presented:

"The project you are trying to view does not exist. Try browsing for projects."

The project and issue have previously been created in jira 3.7.3

The same configuration works in jira 3.7.3.

I tried to reproduce it with atlassian-jira-enterprise-3.9-standalone package but it's possible to create the project. JIRA complains that the project key "TEST2" is not valid for the projectkey.pattern=([A-Z][A-Z][A-Z0-9]+)

I guess this is somehow connected.
fields.summary: Change in projectkey.pattern results in "The project you are trying to view does not exist"

fields.description:
When trying to add a comment remotely, the following error is encountered when trying to add the comment by any user who does not have admin priviledges:

"This issue does not exist or you don't have permission to view it."

This is coming from private MutableIssue retrieveIssue(String issueKey, User user) in IssueServiceImpl.java.  I've tried to get around the issue by removing the permission check at this level, but then in the addComment() method in the same class, it makes a call to commentService.create(...) which similarly fails with a permission issue.
fields.summary: SOAP calls for addComment() fail with permission problems for non -Admin users

fields.description:
In our organisation we have many projects within Jira and many public / global filters.

Most of our users have the portlet "List ALL fliters" but because of the number of projects / users, the number of global filters has grown and grown. This now means that every user displaying this portlet can see every filter visible to them which is a very long and needless list as some filters are just not relevant between the projects.

It would be good if the "List ALL filters" portlet could be configured so only desired filters will be shown. This could also be done on the "manage filters" screen in Jira or in some kind of portlet configuration.
fields.summary: Allow users to select which filters appear in the "List ALL filters" portlet

fields.description:
It is understood that by design custom fields that are specific to an Issue Type will only be displayed if that Issue Type is explicitly selected in a query.

However, if the option Any is selected for Issue Type, this should include all custom fields associated with any Issue Type available in the current context (e.g., Project, etc). Selecting Any is an implicit selection of all individual Issue Types, and thus the Issue Navigator should display all fields, including Issue Type custom fields.
fields.summary: Navigator fails to show Issue Type custom fields

fields.description:
It is understood that by design custom fields that are specific to an Issue Type will only be exported if that Issue Type is explicitly selected in a query.

However, if the option *Any* is selected for Issue Type, this should include all custom fields associated with any Issue Type available in the current context (e.g., Project, etc).  Selecting *Any* is an implicit selection of all individual Issue Types, and thus an export of *All fields* should export all fields, including Issue Type custom fields.
fields.summary: Excel export "All fields" fails to export Issue Type custom fields

fields.description:
In our organisation we use JIRA as the issue tracker between us (developers) and our customers.

Quite often, an issue is opened which describes the overall change required which contains all the information that all parties should see.

However, when it comes down to doing the work, we would like to use sub-tasks to assign development tasks to our developers. The customer should not see these tasks.

Therefore it would be desirable to change the security level of the sub-tasks so that the customer does not see them.
fields.summary: Modify security level of a sub-task

fields.description: Project Administrator should be allowed for creating projects.
fields.summary: Project Administrator should be allowed for creating projects
